maltcms.io.andims
Class NetcdfDataSource

java.lang.Object
  maltcms.io.andims.NetcdfDataSource
All Implemented Interfaces:
IConfigurable, IDataSource
public class NetcdfDataSource
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDataSource

Implementation of IDataSource for Netcdf files, following the ANDI-MS/AIA standard.

Author:
Nils.Hoffmann@cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de

 java.util.ArrayList<Array> readIndexed2(IVariableFragment f)
          ReadIndexed: Read a number of (sparse) arrays written in row-compressed-storage (1D-array of values >0) Row-Compressed-Array: DATA Index array: INDEX with length k=|INDEX| => Number of arrays NOTATION: DATA[FROM,TO,STRIDE], NOTE: TO is inclusive, not up to Require: Index containing offsets into DATA, such that INDEX[0]=DATA[0] and INDEX[i]=start index of array i with 0<=i=k INDEX[i+1] = |DATA|-1 ELSE a[i] = DATA[INDEX[i],INDEX[i+1]-1] ENDIF If we only want to read a subsection of DATA, say j scans starting from scan i, we use Require: NEW_INDEX with length j FOR a=0;a= k SCAN[a] = DATA[INDEX[a],|DATA|-1] ELSE SCAN[a] = DATA[INDEX[a],INDEX[a+1]-1] ENDIF NEW_INDEX[a] = DATA[INDEX[a]]; ENDFOR

readIndexed2

public java.util.ArrayList<Array> readIndexed2(IVariableFragment f)
                                        throws java.io.IOException,
                                               ResourceNotAvailableException,
                                               java.io.FileNotFoundException
ReadIndexed: Read a number of (sparse) arrays written in row-compressed-storage (1D-array of values >0) Row-Compressed-Array: DATA Index array: INDEX with length k=|INDEX| => Number of arrays NOTATION: DATA[FROM,TO,STRIDE], NOTE: TO is inclusive, not up to Require: Index containing offsets into DATA, such that INDEX[0]=DATA[0] and INDEX[i]=start index of array i with 0<=i=k INDEX[i+1] = |DATA|-1 ELSE a[i] = DATA[INDEX[i],INDEX[i+1]-1] ENDIF If we only want to read a subsection of DATA, say j scans starting from scan i, we use Require: NEW_INDEX with length j FOR a=0;a= k SCAN[a] = DATA[INDEX[a],|DATA|-1] ELSE SCAN[a] = DATA[INDEX[a],INDEX[a+1]-1] ENDIF NEW_INDEX[a] = DATA[INDEX[a]]; ENDFOR

Throws:
java.io.IOException
ResourceNotAvailableException
java.io.FileNotFoundException
